s2.ptxt: Using SST and a hammer, tap in the bearing.

atten4.ptxt: After installing the bearing to the hub, make sure that it rotates smoothly.

s2.ptxt: Insert SST into the clutch disc. Then insert SST (together with the clutch disc) into the flywheel.

atten3.ptxt: Make sure not to insert the clutch disc facing the wrong direction.

s2.ptxt: Align the matchmarks on the clutch cover and flywheel.
Tighten the 6 bolts as described below.

s3.ptxt: Determine the first bolt to be tightened by choosing the bolt closest to the knock pin.
Uniformly tighten the 6 bolts in diametrically opposite pairs relative to the position of the first bolt. Use the illustration as a reference.

s2.ptxt: Lightly move SST up and down, and right and left.
Check that the disc is in the center, and then tighten the bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSPECT AND ADJUST CLUTCH COVER ASSEMBLY

s2.ptxt: Using a dial indicator with roller instrument, measure the diaphragm spring tip alignment.

item.ptxt: If the misalignment is greater than the maximum, use SST to adjust the diaphragm spring tip alignment.

s2.ptxt: Install the release fork support to the manual transmission unit.
Install the release bearing hub clip to the release bearing.
Apply Multemp 8158 Grease or equivalent to the following areas.

item.ptxt: The contact surfaces of the release fork and release bearing hub.
The contact surfaces of the release fork and push rod.
The pivot points of the release fork.

s2.ptxt: Install the release fork to the release bearing.
Apply clutch spline grease to the input shaft spline.

specitem.ptxt: Toyota Genuine Clutch Spline Grease or Equivalent

s2.ptxt: Install the release fork (with release bearing) to the manual transmission.

atten3.ptxt: After the installation, move the fork forward and backward to check that the release bearing slides smoothly.
